summary: This is an email chain from July 20, 2021, between a journalist from The Sunday Times and a U.S. Attorney's Office representative regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The journalist asks six specific questions about the trial schedule, sentencing, ongoing investigations, and Prince Andrew's status as a person of interest.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.context: Recipient and forwarder of the journalist's email inquiry about the Ghislaine Maxwell case. He is part of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).

persons.name: James Margolin
persons.context: Copied on the internal email chain regarding the journalist's inquiry about Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Dipesh Gadher
persons.context: Author of the primary email inquiry, asking six specific questions about the Ghislaine Maxwell case, including trial details and the status of Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the journalist's inquiry, facing child sex trafficking and perjury charges. The email discusses her upcoming trials and potential sentence.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Referenced in the journalist's sixth question, asking if he remains a person of interest in the ongoing investigation into Epstein and Maxwell's network and if U.S. prosecutors have obtained a statement from him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of the ongoing investigation into 'Maxwell and Epstein's network'.

connections.description: Referenced together as part of a network under investigation.
The inquiry about Prince Andrew's status as a person of interest is made in the context of the investigation into Maxwell and Epstein's network.
Journalist-source correspondence regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Scheduled start of Maxwell's main trial
events.description: The journalist asks if the main trial on child sex trafficking charges is still scheduled to start in November 2021.

events.title: Period covered by child sex trafficking charges
events.description: The first trial against Ghislaine Maxwell is to cover alleged child sex trafficking activities during this period.

events.title: Perjury charges
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell faces a second, separate trial on perjury charges related to 2016.

locations: London Bridge Street, London SE1 9GF, United Kingdom (The Sunday Times office)
U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
keyFacts: As of July 2021, Ghislaine Maxwell was facing two separate trials: one for child sex trafficking (1994-2004) and a second for perjury (2016).
The main child sex trafficking trial was still scheduled to begin in November 2021 at the time of the inquiry.
The journalist specifically asked if Prince Andrew remained a 'person of interest' in the ongoing investigation into Epstein and Maxwell's network.
The email indicates prior discussions had estimated Maxwell could face up to 80 years in prison.
The correspondence shows direct media inquiry to the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding high-profile aspects of the case.
